citation.article-title: Chryseobacterium yonginense sp. nov., isolated from a mesotrophic artificial lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium yonginense sp. nov.
Chryseobacterium yon.gi.nen′se. (yon.gi.nen′se. N.L. neut. adj. yonginense of or belonging to Yongin, Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-staining-negative, non-motile, strictly aerobic rods (approximately 0.5–0.6 µm in diameter and 0.8–1.0 µm in length).
Colonies on R2A agar are circular with entire margins, smooth, pale yellow, transparent and slimy (approximately 5 mm in diameter after 2 days at 30 °C).
Good growth occurs on MA, TSA and R2A agar.
No growth occurs on cetrimide agar, DNase test agar or MacConkey agar.
Growth occurs with 0–2 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 0.5 % NaCl), at pH 7–8 (optimum pH 7) and at 4–30 °C (optimum 30 °C).
Positive for indole production and gelatin and aesculin hydrolysis, but negative for nitrate reduction, glucose fermentation and arginine dihydrolase, urease and β-galactosidase (API 20 NE).
Non-diffusible flexirubin and carotenoid pigments are produced.

With API ZYM, positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase, but negative for lipase (C14), trypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

With GN2 MicroPlates, utilizes dextrin, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, d-fructose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, maltose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucuronic acid, d-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-phenylalanine, l-pyroglutamic acid, d-serine, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine, thymidine, α-d-glucose-1-phosphate and d-glucose 6-phosphate as sole carbon sources, but does not utilize α-cyclodextrin, glycogen, Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, i-erythritol, l-fucose, d-galactose, myo-inositol, lactose, lactulose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-psicose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, turanose, xylitol, succinic acid monomethyl ester, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, α-, β- and γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, dl-lactic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, glucuronamide, l-alaninamide, l-alanine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-proline, l-serine, l-threonine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol or dl-α-glycerol phosphate.
The major fatty acids (>5 %) are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 9 (comprising iso-C17 : 1ω9c and/or 10-methyl C16 : 0) and iso-C13 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 31.3 mol%.
The type strain, HMD1043T ( = KCTC 22744T = CECT 7547T), was isolated from a mesotrophic artificial lake in Wangsan, Yongin, Gyeonggi, Republic of Korea.
